PERSONA:
john thompson is a 57-year-old white non-hispanic male living in the metropolitan area of new york city, specifically in the suburban neighborhood of glen ridge, new jersey. born and raised in the united states, john has been a lifelong resident of the northeast. he holds some college education, having attended rutgers university but not completing his degree due to starting his career early in the financial sector.

john works as a senior financial analyst at a mid-sized investment firm in manhattan, earning an annual income of $125,000. his wife, emily, is a part-time librarian at a local public library, and together they have two children, both of whom are in college. john's family income is above $150,000 per year, placing him firmly in the upper-income tier. they own a single-family home worth around $700,000 in glen ridge, with a mortgage that they have been paying off diligently.

a devout protestant, john identifies as a conservative republican and has been a registered voter for over three decades. although he seldom attends church services, his protestant upbringing and values continue to influence his political views. he is a strong supporter of fiscal conservatism, advocating for lower taxes and reduced government spending. john is also a firm believer in the importance of a robust national defense and often volunteers at local veteran support organizations.

despite his busy schedule, john finds time to volunteer at a community soup kitchen in newark and participates in local environmental initiatives. he is a frequent user of the internet, almost constantly staying updated on current events and engaging in online discussions on social media platforms.

john's economic priorities include maintaining economic growth, ensuring the stability of the stock market, and protecting the interests of homeowners in his community. he is particularly concerned about property taxes in new jersey and how they might affect his family's financial situation. given his financial background and conservative leanings, john would likely support candidates and policies that advocate for lower taxes and pro-business regulations.
